messages.message:
> Every time we add a field, it is triggering a flash-extraction for all fields
Yep, I recall this was a decision the team aligned on before, but yes we can change this pattern :ok_hand:
^ yup I know we aligned on it for build app-run parity. It does make things quite slow - especially if you have a few table fields in the mix.

Where should we put the option to rerun all fields?

I think this is a significant change to the Build UI since (1) currently fields always run automatically and (2) it’ll be very easy for the user to see different results in Build vs app runs if they forget to rerun all fields :disappointed:

Cc @margaret.tomaszczuk @Natasha
No need to re-run all right now. My proposal for now

We need to support > 25 fields
Instead of making lot of changes
Group in chunks of 25 and do extraction

Say I add a field, choose other fields and run extraction - don’t choose table/list as they can take a while. This is to mimic parity.

ticket https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/AUTO-613
@Weiming Wu is working on this
@Weiming Wu is it feasible to implement and backport this by 4pm today? this sounds really tight to me
@Weiming Wu - thanks - lets double check to make sure this doesn’t affect anything when agent mode is not being used.
If you can test that explicity - disable agent mode, test a project with large number of fields - nothing breaks.

Team, per @Anil’s comment above, while we are moving quickly here want to emphasize that we should be cautious of deploying anything that would impact stability of the code base outside of agent mode. we do have enterprise customers in MT who will get 25.36 on monday who we need to support consistently (BMG, Kering).
